DataElement.preferredName: Dental Pulp Exposure Endodontic Treatment Caries Removal Carious Dentin Administered Average Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed of average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) for administration of endodontic (dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp, and may include palliative treatment) dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp of exposed tooth pulp decayed tooth that has invaded the dentin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dental Pulp Exposure Endodontic Treatment Caries Removal Carious Dentin Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to administration of endodontic (dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp, and may include palliative treatment) dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp of exposed tooth pulp decayed tooth that has invaded the dentin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.:Contact with infectious agents (bacteria or viruses) in a manner that promotes transmission and increases the likelihood of disease. (CDC):Dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp, and may include palliative treatment.

Concepts.definition: A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.
The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.
Dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp, and may include palliative treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.:Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.
Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, creating dentin that is partially demineralized and containing mineral crystals in the tubules.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Endodontic Treatment Administered Average Percentage Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed of average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) for endodontic treatment administered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The central tendency of a set of n numbers; lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
